title: Data Cleaning Strategies
body_html:
The following strategies ensure that only high-quality, relevant data is used for web research, improving Large Language Model (LLM) outputs and downstream analytics:

  1. Source Credibility Assessment

    • Filter unreliable sources using domain blacklists/whitelists and credibility checks.

  2. Boilerplate Content Removal

    • Strip non-essential webpage elements (navigation, ads, cookie banners, sidebars, etc.) to minimize noise.

  3. De-duplication

    • Identify and remove exact or near-duplicate content using hash-based or semantic similarity checks.

  4. Format Normalization

    • Convert HTML to plain text with standardized encoding (UTF-8); handle special characters consistently.

  5. Filtering Irrelevant Sections

    • Use heuristics or keyword filters to isolate main content, excluding unrelated sections (comments, bios, etc.).

  6. Identifying & Handling Errors/Noise

    • Detect and correct encoding errors, broken HTML, and script remnants for cleaner input.

Note on SearxNG: SearxNGâ€™s default workflow already covers many of these strategies, including filtering, de-duplication, and boilerplate removal. Documenting these steps ensures transparency and provides a foundation for custom extensions or integration with other search tools.

For more information, visit the Optimized Web Research book or refer to the main workflow documentation.
